Right i finally got this to work, follow @sharky4687 discription of what to do and i got it to work, its nothing to do with gfwl or if you have gta4 already on ure system, its all to do with the regedit setting, start with a fresh extraction, delete anything youve done already including the .reg files youve added, and extract the files to this exact locastion 

C:\Program Files\Rockstar Games\Grand Theft Auto IV - Episodes From Liberty City

You dont need to change the .reg file in the crack then, and then just follow these exact instructions, also make sure the contents of EFLC is in the location above and not in the EFLC folder.


Alright I got this working perfectly on W7 x64

This is how you do:

1.Download this torrent (ofc.)
2. Download http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/5497507/GTA_IV__Episodes_From_Liberty_City_Crack___.Reg (If it shows that it's a virus I recommend that you should uninstall your AV because it sucks)
3. extract The game into C:\program files\rockstar games\
4. extract the crack into the EFLC folder. double click the EFLCINSTALL.reg file and apply.
5. open up regedit and locate HKEY_LOAD_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\ROCKSTAR GAMES\EFLC

AND (If you're using x64 I think)

HKEY_LOAD_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\Wow6432Node\ROCKSTAR GAMES\EFLC

now you should make new strings in the wow6432 folder. Give them the same name and value as the ones in HKEY_LOAD_MACHINE\SOFTWARE\ROCKSTAR GAMES\EFLC

now to InstallFolder key you should type in the location of the game.. e.g. "C:\Program Files (x86)\Rockstar Games\Grand Theft Auto IV - Episodes From Liberty City\EFLC"
5. Install games for windows - live program
6. Start the game with LaunchEFLC
And im running Win 7 x64

"Load Failed. Start A New Game." Crash Problem:

Follow this instruction after installing the registry using EFLC install.reg from EFLC-mbb.rar

If you are using Windows 7. Run regedit. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE/SOFTWARE/Rockstar Games/EFLC

Then check the "InstallFolder" registry and check if its exactly the same as where you have put your copy of the installed game files.

In my case its a simple mistake of the registry stating install folder is "C:\Program Files\Rockstar Games\Grand Theft Auto IV - Episodes From Liberty City" 

while i put my installation in "C:\Program Files\Rockstar Games\Grand Theft Auto IV - Episode From Liberty City" 

Did you notice the missing 's' in "Episode" ?? :D

Hope this solve your problem.. enjoy..

FOR THOSE EXPERIENCING THE "No Download content available" message and subsequent crash:

The .reg file is wrong. The registry entry should point to %GAMEDIR%/EFLC folder, not the root one. I.e. if you want to have the game in "D:/games/GTAIV EFLC" folder, then the InstallFolder reg entry should point to "D:/games/GTAIV EFLC/EFLC". So either fix the .reg file or the entry in the registry (HKLM/Software/Rockstar Games/EFLC/InstallDir)

Have fun!
